content.description:
This is a mostly fingers and tight hands, arching crack. Start as low and to the right as you can. The rock is a bit crumbly, and you may need to excavate to expose a crucial, very small foothold near the start.

Ground rules: sit start, and finish by cutting right at the top.
content.protection: None - the ground will keep you from falling too far.
content.location: This is about 3 miles along Rampart Range Road on the south side near parking/camping spot #15. See the detail map.

content.description:
This is mostly hands. I recommend bringing tools to garden the bush/tree partway up the route before you climb it.

Ground rules: none - anything goes.
content.location:
See the overview map. The Power Line Boulder is barely visible looking north from CO Hwy 67 about 0.25 mile west of the RRR turnoff.

This is the right crack.

content.description:
This is mostly hands.

Ground rules for 10d: sit start.

Ground rules for 5.9: standing start.
content.location:
See the overview map. The Power Line Boulder is barely visible looking north from CO Hwy 67 about 0.25 mile west of the RRR turnoff.

This is the obvious crack in the center.

content.description: Hunker onto the ramp/flake, then go up right and onto face.
content.protection: A TR is recommended using the block at the top for an anchor (long sling or cams?). It's not over till the top.
content.location:
See the overview map. The Power Line Boulder is barely visible looking north from CO Hwy 67 about 0.25 mile west of the RRR turnoff.

It is on the left side of the boulder.

content.description:
This is a nice splitter along the road. It is mostly hands with some tighter.

Ground rules: sit start for the maximum challenge. The standing start is not a give away.

Don't park along the road, even in the wide area across the road - you may be ticketed.
content.location: This is along CO Hwy 67 about 0.75 miles west of the Rampart Range Road turnoff.
